Primary Contact: Philip Jansen, Manager, Rotary Lodge of the Southern Interior, Canadian Cancer Society; Phone: 250.712.2203
Volunteer Coordinator: Lori Pierson, Volunteer/Community Engagement Coordinator; Phone: 250.762.6381; Email: lori.pierson@bc.cancer.ca
Service Details: - Offers a safe, supportive, reasonably priced lodge for cancer patients while accessing treatment at the Cancer Centre - Amenities include air conditioned rooms, lounge dining room, outdoor patio, activity room, library/resource room, and on-site laundry- Services include Freemason drivers for transport to medical appointments as well as to and from the lodge for out of town guests, a wig and breast prosthesis bank, Look Good Feel Better program, Cancer information and support - Rooms are shared with ensuite and some offer a queen bed option - Whenever possible, loved ones can stay with guests - Facilities are smoke-free, scent-free and wheelchair accessible - There is a reasonable user fee for lodge guests which includes meals - Offers easy access to information and provides on-site staff 24 hours a day to provide support and information to guests
Hours: Mon-Sun Closed during Christmas and Easter
Address & Map: 2251 Abbott StKelowna, BC     V1Y 1E2View MapQuest Map
